Award.AwardTitle: MALDI-based Research-like Experiences in a 2YC/4YC Collaboration with a Renewable Fuels Industry Partner

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
Developing an advanced technological workforce hinges on successful academic and industry partnerships that provide students with hands on experience with cutting edge technology. The Research-Infused MALDI Modules (RIMM) initiative is a collaboration between Anoka-Ramsey Community College (ARCC); the University of Wisconsin-Stout; and Ever Cat Fuels, a renewable fuels company. By integrating research and education, the RIMM modules are transforming the curriculum to include vibrant inquiry-based experiences that incorporate the use of Matrix-Assisted Laser Desorption Ionization Time of Flight (MALDI-TOF) mass spectrometry, a sensitive technology that excels at the molecular analysis of biomolecules. Students are gaining hands-on experience in MALDI-TOF mass spectrometry and exploring scientific questions that include: biomolecule extraction methods, microchromotography, renewable fuels, and biodiesel synthesis.

MALDI-TOF mass spectrometry is particularly well-suited to undergraduate research. Acknowledged as important in biomedical research and chemistry, MALDI-TOF applications are still emerging in many applied areas, including environmental studies, polymers, and food science. Yet, despite the wide-ranging utility of MALDI-TOF methods, it is rare that an undergraduate would have hands-on experience operating a MALDI-TOF mass spectrometer. This project is integrating MALDI-TOF mass spectrometry first into the chemistry curriculum followed by the biology curriculum to enhance the undergraduate learning environment and empower undergraduates to enthusiastically pursue science. The partnership with Ever Cat Fuels also provides students with career opportunities in the renewable fuels field.

The broader impacts of this project include the partnership serving as a model for how institutions can collaborate to enhance research and instrument access to students, and the infusion of undergraduate research at the community college supporting the retention of under-represented groups (first-generation college students and women). It is also expected that exposing this population to the opportunities at UW-Stout offers an exceptional potential to improve diversity at UW-Stout while promoting retention of students into a four-year program.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This project generated several educational tools to teach theory and practical applications of Matrix-Assisted Laser Desorption Ionization-Time of Flight (MALDI-TOF) mass spectrometry with hands-on learning in a research-like project for students in 2-year and 4-year colleges. The curricular items are freely available for use and include two YouTube videos, 5 in-class guided-inquiry activities, data analysis tools for students, several online and paper content quizzes, as well as instructor and student guides and support documents. Students collected, analyzed, and reported on seed oil data to our industrial partner.

A strength of this work was collaboration between a 2-year college (Anoka-Ramsey Community College), primarily undergraduate University (University of Wisconsin-Stout), a large research university (University of Minnesota-Twin Cities), and a private sector biofuels company (EverCat Fuels). The project demonstrated the success of a single-day research trip to both close and distant institutions as a viable way to give hands-on access to major research instrumentation as demonstrated by student outcomes and surveys.

 

Intellectual Merit:

- The MALDI-TOF YouTube videos continue to educate by receiving approximately 2700 and 790 views per month, respectively, for a total of over 105,000 and over 23,500 views by the end of the project period.

- Four external United States institutions have been identified as having incorporated all or part of the curricular items into their instruction each year and Anoka-Ramsey continues to use them.

- Project faculty received professional development training in this field and shared aspects of the training in more than 8 professional scientific conferences.

- Data were gathered on several types of potential biofuels feedstocks and shared with EverCat Fuels.

-Several manuscripts to share outcomes of this project are under preparation at the time of submission of this document.

 

Broader Impacts:

- Anoka-Ramsey was able to benefit from the NSF-MRI program funding the University of Minnesota’s acquisition of a MALDI-TOF spectrometer for this work. (NSF-MRI #1336940)

- Several international institutions have made use of this work to in the education of students in the topic. Among the international users are the United Kingdom and Iceland.

- The PI worked with the EvaluATE project center (NSF-ATE #1600992) to share his experience and encourage closer collaboration between project personnel and external (and internal) evaluators.

- Analysis of student outcomes and satisfaction surveys are being compiled to support this model of collaborative partnerships to give hands-on access to technical equipment.

- Workflow suggestions for single-day research trips have been shared at professional conferences.

-To date, over 130 students at Anoka-Ramsey and over 190 students at other institutions have benefited from this work.
